etymology.description: semantic: 艹(艹) (cǎo, 'grass') + phonetic: 帝(帝) (dì, 'emperor') = part of a plant -> stem
etymology.interpretation: The character 蒂(蒂) (dì, 'stem') combines the 艹(艹) (cǎo, 'grass') radical, indicating its relation to plants, with 帝(帝) (dì, 'emperor') as a phonetic component. This suggests something foundational or central, much like a stem.

examples.chinese: 采摘花朵时(採摘花朵時)，注意保护花蒂(注意保護花蒂)。
examples.pinyin: Cǎizhāi huāduǒ shí, zhùyì bǎohù huādì.
examples.english: When picking flowers, pay attention to protecting the stem.

examples.chinese: 这束花的蒂突出(這束花的蒂突出)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shù huā de huādì tūchū.
examples.english: The stem of this bouquet stands out.
